expression.Value: In this tutorial you will learn the expression for time representation and time operations.
In this tutorial the concept of daylight saving time is illustrated. The time zone has been set as
expression represents a single point in the timeline. It has a precision of milliseconds. It is neither associated with any timezone nor any calendar.
At start of the day (hour 0, minute 0, second 0, millisecond 0)
When in the BC (before Christ) era
Even when a time is not associated with a calendar, the visualization of it is made according to the

Even when a time is not associated with a timezone, the visualization of it is made according with the timezone of your computer. You can change temporarily or definitively the timezone to be used. It could be useful if you travel to a place with different timezone and you want to see the times in such that timezone.

There is an ambiguity for time zones that observe daylight saving time. For example, in 2000 on the time zone associated with Los Angeles, the daylight saving time started in April the 2nd. at 2:00 AM, so the next minute after 1:59 AM was 3:00 AM instead of 2:00 AM. There was a
between 2:00 AM and 3:00 AM. Before 2:00 AM it was
and at and after 3:00 AM it was
Conversely, the daylight saving time ended in October 29 at 2:00 AM, so the next minute after 1:59 AM was 1:00 AM (again, but in standard time) instead of 2:00 AM. There was a
between 1:00 AM and 2:00 AM. The first occured (chronologically) in daylight saving time while the second one was in standard time.
See the following chart (the horizontal axis is time, from the start to the end of 2000. It is not in scale):
If you select the edition Time → Time, the following dialog box appears, where you con select the values of the time expression to create:
expression you can create a time expression, given the values of different time components:
The following are the values you can use when creating a time expression:
Whether the time is in daylight saving or not
It is not valid to set the year as zero. There were no
A negative year means a year in the BC (before Christ) era.
Several months, or combinations of year/month will accept up to 28, 29 o 30 days.
An attempt to create a time with year as zero will produce an error:
An error is also produced if you try to create a time between the "gap" fo the daylight saving time:
If you try to create a time between the "overlap", an error is produced:
For such that cases (a time in the overlap), the last parameter is needed. Notice that it is very rare (it happens during one hour in a year).
Programatic creation of time expressions for a different timezone
but the first parameter is a time zone where the time is referred. However, the resulting time expression is always referred to the current time zone.
There are several expression to retrieve components of a given time expressions, for example:
The following is the complete list of expressions:
The year of the given time, in the current time zone
The month of the given time, in the current time zone
The day of month of the given time, in the current time zone
The day of year of the given time, in the current time zone
The week day of the given time, in the current time zone
The hour of the given time, in 12-hour format, in the current time zone
The meridiem of the given time, in the current time zone
The hour of the given time, in 24-hour format, in the current time zone
The minute of the given time, in the current time zone
The second of the given time, in the current time zone
The millisecond of the given time, in the current time zone
Whether the given time is in daylight saving or not, in the current time zone
expression retrieves the components that uniquely defines the given time. The result is a list of 9 elements containing the following expressions:
The hour of the day (in 24-hour format)
Whether the time is in daylight saving or not
expression is useful if you want to add or subtract units of time for one or several time components, from a given Time expression.
First parameter must be a time expression.
Parameters second to last must be integer numbers. They can be positive, negative (to subtract) or zero.
The result is another time expression.
To show that there was no year zero, the last millisecond of the year 1BC was (BC) December 31, at 23:59:59:999. Adding a single millisecond to it we will get:
A Time expression can be compared against another one, by the using of the Equals, Different, Greater, GreaterOrEquals, Less, LessOrEquals or Compare expressions:
The order is chronological, a Time expression is less than other, if it occured before:
Which event occurs first, the tea in London, or noon in New York?
Formatting a time for a different time zone
You have learned that time expressions show time for the current time zone. However, you can format (as a string) a time expression for a different time zone, with the
The first argument is the time itself, and te second one is a time zone expression.
Formatting a time for a different locale
The second argument can be also a locale expression:
Formatting a time for a different time zone and locale
You can even specify both a time zone and a locale:
Each time expression contains internally an integer value that represents the number o milliseconds since a reference time known as "the epoch", which is 1970 January 1st at 00:00 hrs. in the
timezone. Time before the epoch is represented as a negative integer.
expression generates a time expression given the number of milliseconds from epoch.
The following example retrieves the epoch. Notice that you may not get exactly the time of definition because of the offset between you timezone and the UTC timezone:
According with the previous section, it can be obtained with:
expression does the opposite, it retrieves the number of milleseconds since the epoch of a given time expression:

The minimum value for the milliseconds from the epoch a time expression can hold is -9,223,372,036,854,775,808, while the maximus is 9,223,372,036,854,775,807 (minimum/maximum values on 64-bit signed two's complement integer). Hence, the minimum/maximum expressable values for a time expression are ±100,000,000 (one hundred million) days before/after epoch:
